Analyze two research papers and find their document representations or embeddings.\n###Input: {'papers': [{'title': 'BERT: Pre-training of Deep Bidirectional Transformers for Language Understanding', 'abstract': 'We introduce a new language representation model called BERT, which stands for Bidirectional Encoder Representations from Transformers. Unlike recent language representation models, BERT is designed to pre-train deep bidirectional representations from unlabeled text by jointly conditioning on both left and right context.'}, {'title': 'Attention is All You Need', 'abstract': 'The dominant sequence transduction models are based on complex recurrent or convolutional neural networks in an encoder-decoder configuration. The best performing models also connect the encoder and decoder through an attention mechanism. We propose a new transformer which handles variability by introducing a self-attention mechanism for the entire network without using an encoder-decoder architecture.'}]}\n

Prolonged droughts, floods, and heatwaves can lead to diminished crop yields and decreased agricultural output, while erratic weather patterns can disrupt the delicate balance of pollinators and pests, further complicating agricultural production. Moreover, the unpredictability of rainfall can cause severe water scarcity in some areas, while increased evaporation rates may result in less available freshwater resources for irrigation. This, in turn, will put immense pressure on farmers, who are already grappling with the challenges of feeding a growing global population. In response to these challenges, scientists and policymakers are exploring various strategies for advancing agricultural resilience to climate change. Some approaches include adopting climate-smart agricultural practices, such as intercropping, agroforestry, and conservation agriculture, which can help mitigate the impact of climate change on crop productivity. Additionally, the development of new, drought-resistant crop varieties could prove essential in ensuring food security in the face of climate upheaval. On a broader scale, comprehensive climate change adaptation policies and investment in research, development, and technology transfer will play a critical role in enabling agricultural systems to better withstand the impacts of a changing climate. \n

The most common methods include the 16:8 method, which involves fasting for 16 hours a day and eating during an eight-hour window, and the 5:2 method, which involves eating normally for five days a week and restricting calorie intake to 500-600 calories for the remaining two days. Advocates of intermittent fasting claim that it can lead to weight loss, improved metabolism, and increased energy levels. Some research supports these claims, with studies showing that intermittent fasting can help individuals lose weight, improve insulin sensitivity, and lower inflammation levels. However, not all experts agree on the benefits of intermittent fasting, as some argue that it can be difficult to adhere to for extended periods of time and may lead to disordered eating patterns or nutritional deficiencies. It is essential for individuals considering intermittent fasting to consult with a healthcare professional before making significant changes to their diet.\"\n

The India pacer however came with a brilliant reply as he gestured 1-0 (India leading the Test series) towards the crowd.Earlier this month, during the second Test match, there was some bad crowd behaviour on a show as some unruly fans threw champagne corks at India batsman KL Rahul.Kohli also intervened and he was seen gesturing towards the opening batsman to know more about the incident. An over later, the TV visuals showed that many champagne corks were thrown inside the playing field, and the Indian players were visibly left frustrated.Coming back to the game, after bundling out India for 78, openers Rory Burns and Haseeb Hameed ensured that England took the honours on the opening day of the ongoing third Test.At stumps, England's score reads 120/0 and the hosts have extended their lead to 42 runs. For the Three Lions, Burns (52) and Hameed (60) are currently unbeaten at the crease.Talking about the pitch on opening day, Pant said, They took the heavy roller, the wicket was much more settled down, and they batted nicely also, he said. But when we batted, the wicket was slightly soft, and they bowled in good areas, but we could have applied [ourselves] much better.Both England batsmen managed to see off the final session and the hosts concluded the opening day with all ten wickets intact, extending the lead to 42.(ANI)\n

NCB will pay 28.45 riyals ($7.58) for each Samba share, according to a statement on Sunday, valuing it at about 55.7 billion riyals. NCB will offer 0.739 new shares for each Samba share, at the lower end of the 0.736-0.787 ratio the banks set when they signed an initial framework agreement in June. The offer is a 3.5% premium to Sambas Oct. 8 closing price of 27.50 riyals and about 24% higher than the level the shares traded at before the talks were made public. Bloomberg News first reported the merger discussions. The new bank will have total assets of more than $220 billion, creating the Gulf regions third-largest lender. The entitys $46 billion market capitalization nearly matches that of Qatar National Bank QPSC, which is still the Middle Easts biggest lender with about $268 billion of assets.\n

Summarize an article about the latest technological advancements in automation.\n###Input: Automation has been rapidly advancing, with new developments in robotics, artificial intelligence, and machine learning technologies. One of the most significant breakthroughs in recent years is the ability to enable machines to learn iteratively from experience, through enhanced pattern recognition and optimization techniques. This has given rise to a new generation of intelligent systems, capable of adapting and improving their performance over time and with exposure to new data. Some of the biggest innovations in automation include advanced robotics like collaborative robots, autonomous vehicles, drones, and specialized AI systems for applications such as image and voice recognition, language translation, and advanced analytics. These technologies have the potential to improve safety, efficiency, and productivity, while also creating new opportunities for technology entrepreneurs and businesses alike. However, the rapid pace of innovation has raised concerns about job displacement, data privacy, and cybersecurity risks. Policymakers and stakeholders are grappling with important ethical, legal, and regulatory questions as these new technologies become increasingly integrated into everyday life.\n

Summarize the key information from this news article about a cricket incident.
###Input: 
India wicket-keeper batsman Rishabh Pant has said someone from the crowd threw a ball on pacer Mohammed Siraj while he was fielding in the ongoing third Test against England on Wednesday. Pant revealed the incident made India skipper Virat Kohli upset. "I think, somebody threw a ball inside, at Siraj, so he [Kohli] was upset," said Pant in a virtual press conference after the close of the first day's play. "You can say whatever you want to chant, but don't throw things at the fielders and all those things. It is not good for cricket, I guess," he added. In the third session of the opening day of the third Test, a section of spectators seemed to have asked Siraj the score of the match to tease the pacer. The India pacer, however, came with a brilliant reply as he gestured 1-0 (India leading the Test series) towards the crowd. Earlier this month, during the second Test match, there was some bad crowd behavior on a show as some unruly fans threw champagne corks at India batsman KL Rahul. Kohli also intervened and he was seen gesturing towards the opening batsman to know more about the incident. An over later, the TV visuals showed that many champagne corks were thrown inside the playing field, and the Indian players were visibly left frustrated. Coming back to the game, after bundling out India for 78, openers Rory Burns and Haseeb Hameed ensured that England took the honours on the opening day of the ongoing third Test. At stumps, England's score reads 120/0 and the hosts have extended their lead to 42 runs. For the Three Lions, Burns (52) and Hameed (60) are currently unbeaten at the crease. Talking about the pitch on the opening day, Pant said, "They took the heavy roller, the wicket was much more settled down, and they batted nicely also," he said. "But when we batted, the wicket was slightly soft, and they bowled in good areas, but we could have applied [ourselves] much better."

We have a large text describing a financial transaction. We need to extract the main information into a brief summary.
###Input:
National Commercial Bank (NCB), Saudi Arabias largest lender by assets, agreed to buy rival Samba Financial Group for $15 billion in the biggest banking takeover this year. NCB will pay 28.45 riyals ($7.58) for each Samba share, according to a statement on Sunday, valuing it at about 55.7 billion riyals. NCB will offer 0.739 new shares for each Samba share, at the lower end of the 0.736-0.787 ratio the banks set when they signed an initial framework agreement in June. The offer is a 3.5% premium to Sambas Oct. 8 closing price of 27.50 riyals and about 24% higher than the level the shares traded at before the talks were made public. Bloomberg News first reported the merger discussions. The new bank will have total assets of more than $220 billion, creating the Gulf regions third-largest lender. The entitys $46 billion market capitalization nearly matches that of Qatar National Bank QPSC, which is still the Middle Easts biggest lender with about $268 billion of assets.

Google's program, called the 'Local Experiments Project,' seeks to bolster smaller newspapers that often bear the brunt of financial hardships in the industry. As part of the initiative, Google will provide funding for dozens of new publications, which will help support their day-to-day operations as well as their overall mission of providing quality journalism to their communities. According to Google, the first phase of this project will focus primarily on small urban communities in regions with limited access to local news. These communities will be selected based on criteria such as population size, location, and income levels, ensuring that they represent a diverse range of voices from various parts of the country. The tech giant's support of local news outlets aims to address the so-called 'news desert' phenomenon in which communities face a dearth of reliable sources for local news and information. The company's venture into local news also represents an opportunity for Google to cultivate stronger relationships with news organizations, which have long criticized the search engine giant's role in the decline of the journalism industry.\"\n
